newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa seeks bids for Sun Air privatisation.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa seeks bids for Sun Air privatisation.

text.p: South Africa's government said on Monday it was seeking pre-qualification bids for the privatisation of state-owned airline Sun Air from prospective bidders by April 10.
The government is selling 100 percent of the airline, formerly the carrier for the nominally independent homeland of Bophuthatswana, as part of its privatisation drive.
The sale will comprise three stages -- pre-qualification, submission of non-binding offers and final offers/completion.
Richard Branson's Virgin group is among those to have expressed an interest in acquiring the airline. The sale is being handled by merchant back BOE NatWest and legal adviser Moseneke Partners.
